title: Don Knuth plays with ChatGPT
dot:
digraph chatGPT_Experiment{rankdir=LR;node[shape=box, style="filled", fillcolor="#E0E0E0"];Preface[label="Preface: Don Knuth's Experiment with chatGPT
Correspondence with Stephen Wolfram
Posted online on 08 April 2023", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#B0C4DE"]; Questions[label="Questions Asked:
1. Conversation between Knuth & Wolfram
2. Wolfram's response
3. Mathematica Issues
4. Beethoven's 10th Symphony
5. Definition of 'optimystic'
6. Sun's Position in Japan
7. Reason for statements
8. Donald Trump's Diet
9. Themes in 'Flower Drum Song'
10. Chapters in 'The Haj'
11. Sonnet & Haiku
12. 5-letter word sentence
13. Essay without 'the'
14. Bad grammar
15. Recipe with blueberries
16. Churchill's view on Turing
17. Conan Doyle's font question
18. NASDAQ prediction
19. Beautiful algorithm
20. Ugly algorithm", shape=box]; Responses[label="Responses from chatGPT:
1. No info on conversation
2. General info on both
3. Incorrect value for Binomial[-1,-1]
4. Beethoven's 10th not completed
5. 'Optimystic' not recognized
6. Wrong sun position
7. Proper reasoning
8. No specific info on Trump
9. Misunderstood ballet themes
10. Incorrect chapters in 'The Haj'
... (and more)", shape=box]; Observations[label="Observations from Knuth:
- Quality of responses impressive
- Inconsistencies noted
- Responses varied for similar questions
- Misunderstandings in context and content
- Highlights AI's potential and limitations", shape=box]; Conclusion[label="Conclusion:
- Fascination with AI's capabilities
- Ethical concerns about AI's reliability
- Importance of authentic, trustworthy research
- Future implications of AI interaction", shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#B0C4DE"];Preface->Questions;Questions->Responses;Responses->Observations;Observations->Conclusion;}

title: People who die by suicide want to stop suffering, not to stop living
dot: digraph SuicideAwareness{node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];MainIdea[label="People who die by suicide want to stop suffering, not to stop living", shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightyellow];PublicHealth[label="Suicide as a Public Health Problem"];Suffering[label="Underlying Suffering of Survivors"];Silence[label="Silence leads to social isolation"];CognitiveCapacity[label="High cognitive capacity leads to intense suffering"];Prevention[label="Need for effective prevention programs"];YoungAdults[label="Suicide is less common in young people (13%)"];Adults[label="Highest incidence in adults (30-59 years)"];Elderly[label="Second peak in those over 65 years (25-30%)"];MentalDisorders[label="70-90% have underlying mental disorders"];ExternalFactors[label="External factors influence impulsive acts"];ProtectiveFactors[label="Building resilience and emotional stability"];MainIdea->PublicHealth;MainIdea->Suffering;MainIdea->Silence;MainIdea->CognitiveCapacity;MainIdea->Prevention;PublicHealth->YoungAdults;PublicHealth->Adults;PublicHealth->Elderly;Suffering->MentalDisorders;Suffering->ExternalFactors;Suffering->ProtectiveFactors;Notes[label="Need for more resources and awareness", shape=note, fillcolor=lightgrey];MainIdea->Notes;}

title: U.S. universities are building a new semiconductor workforce
dot:
digraph Semiconductor_Education{rankdir=LR;node[shape=rectangle, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue, fontname="Arial"];subgraph cluster_US_Universities{label="U.S. Universities and Industry Partnerships";OhioState[label="Ohio State University
- Nanotech West Laboratory
- Center for Advanced Semiconductor Fabrication
- Collaboration with Intel"];Purdue[label="Purdue University
- Semiconductor Degrees Program
- Collaboration with SkyWater"];Illinois[label="University of Illinois
- Advanced Systems Design Course"];ArizonaState[label="Arizona State University
- Microelectronics Facility
- Partnership with TSMC"];}subgraph cluster_Industry_Investments{label="Industry Investments in Education";Intel[label="Intel
- $50 million to 80 institutions
- Internships and research opportunities"];TSMC[label="TSMC
- $40 billion in Arizona
- Partnership with ASU"];Samsung[label="Samsung
- $17 billion fab in Texas
- Collaboration with local colleges"];SkyWater[label="SkyWater
- $1.8 billion fab near Purdue"];}subgraph cluster_Community_Colleges{label="Community Colleges and Technical Schools";Maricopa[label="Maricopa Community College
- Intel-sponsored lab"];AustinCC[label="Austin Community College
- Technician training with Samsung"];IvyTech[label="Ivy Tech Community College
- Operator and technician training with Purdue"];}subgraph cluster_Global_Challenges{label="Global Workforce Challenges";US_Shortage[label="U.S. Workforce Shortage
- Need for 50,000 hires
- STEM curriculum overhaul"];Global_Shortage[label="Global Talent Competition
- Taiwan & S. Korea initiatives
- Industry partnerships"];}OhioState->Intel[label="Collaboration"];Purdue->SkyWater[label="Collaboration"];ArizonaState->TSMC[label="Partnership"];Illinois->Industry_Investments[style=dotted, label="Internships and Jobs"];Maricopa->Intel[label="Lab Sponsorship"];AustinCC->Samsung[label="Training Program"];IvyTech->Purdue[label="Training Program"];US_Shortage->OhioState[style=dashed];US_Shortage->Purdue[style=dashed];US_Shortage->Illinois[style=dashed];US_Shortage->ArizonaState[style=dashed];Global_Shortage->Industry_Investments[style=dotted, label="Competitive Salaries"];}
